PageObserver

This class allows other classes to subscribe to page events.  When an event occurs the PageObserver calls their callback function and passes along the relevant details.

Summary
PageObserver
This class allows other classes to subscribe to page events.
Constants
PMOG_STATE_START
PMOG_STATE_STOP
PMOG_STATE_IS_DOCUMENT
Functions
PageObserver
Initializes the Object
init
Initializes the object to its default settings

Simple page observer, which monitors page loads, but does not track switching between tab windows etc.

Use this instead of “pageLoadInit” if you want to track more complex events in addition to page loads.

Remove the progress listener.

Allow other Javascript objects to subscribe to events observed by this class

Iterate through all the event subscribers and evoke their respective callback method.

Callback method triggered by the user resizing the browser

Callback method triggered by the user scrolling the browser.

A method to return the scroll offset from the browser window.

Find the width and height of the page.
getViewportSize
Find the width and height of the viewable area in the browser.
getScrollBarSize
Find the width and height of the scrollbars.
isTopLevelDocument
This method iterates through the available browsers to determine if aDocument matches their ‘contentDocument’.
QueryInterface
Required callback method defined as part of the progress listener class.
onStateChange
If you use myListener for more than one tab/window, use aProgress.DOMWindow to obtain the tab/window which triggers the state change.
onLocationChange
This fires when the location bar changes; i.e load event is confirmed or when the user switches tabs.
getLocation
Process the location properties that refer to the current location of the document.
getDocument
Document instance.
getBody
Return just the body DOM element of the document.

Constants

PMOG_STATE_START

PMOG_STATE_STOP

PMOG_STATE_IS_DOCUMENT

Functions

PageObserver

PageObserver = function()

Initializes the Object

init

PageObserver.prototype.init = function()

Initializes the object to its default settings

pageLoadInit

PageObserver.prototype.pageLoadInit = function()

Simple page observer, which monitors page loads, but does not track switching between tab windows etc.

Usage

window.addEventListener("load", function() { observer.pageLoadInit(); }, false);

progressListenerInit

PageObserver.prototype.progressListenerInit = function()

Use this instead of “pageLoadInit” if you want to track more complex events in addition to page loads.  For example use this method if you want to track the switching between tab windows.

Usage

window.addEventListener("load", function() { observer.progressListenerInit() }, false);

progressListenerUninit

PageObserver.prototype.progressListenerUninit = function()

Remove the progress listener.

Usage

window.addEventListener("unload", function() { observer.progressListenerUninit() }, false);

subscribe

PageObserver.prototype.subscribe = function(evt,
obj)

Allow other Javascript objects to subscribe to events observed by this class

Parameters

evtthe event to which to subscribe.
objthe object which shall be added to the subscriber’s array.

Usage

observer.subscribe("onload", my_obj }, false);

callback

PageObserver.prototype.callback = function(method)

Iterate through all the event subscribers and evoke their respective callback method.

Parameters

methodThe callback method to invoke, when an event occurs.

onPageLoad

PageObserver.prototype.onPageLoad = function(evn)

Callback method triggered by the pageLoad event when the pageObserver is inited using

Parameters

evnThe event that triggered the onPageLoad.

onPageResize

PageObserver.prototype.onPageResize = function(evn)

Callback method triggered by the user resizing the browser

Parameters

evnThe event that called onPageResize

onPageScroll

PageObserver.prototype.onPageScroll = function()

Callback method triggered by the user scrolling the browser.

getScrollXY

PageObserver.prototype.getScrollXY = function()

A method to return the scroll offset from the browser window. switching between tab windows etc.

getPageSize

PageObserver.prototype.getPageSize = function()

Find the width and height of the page.

getViewportSize

PageObserver.prototype.getViewportSize = function()

Find the width and height of the viewable area in the browser.

getScrollBarSize

PageObserver.prototype.getScrollBarSize = function()

Find the width and height of the scrollbars.

isTopLevelDocument

PageObserver.prototype.isTopLevelDocument = function(aDocument)

This method iterates through the available browsers to determine if aDocument matches their ‘contentDocument’.

Parameters

aDocumentContentDocument

QueryInterface

PageObserver.prototype.QueryInterface = function(aIID)

Required callback method defined as part of the progress listener class.

Parameters

aIIDInstance of the QueryInterface

onStateChange

PageObserver.prototype.onStateChange = function(aProgress,
aRequest,
aFlag,
aStatus)

If you use myListener for more than one tab/window, use aProgress.DOMWindow to obtain the tab/window which triggers the state change.

Parameters

aProgressObject
aRequestObject (unused but required)
aFlagObject
aStatusObject (unused but required)

onLocationChange

PageObserver.prototype.onLocationChange = function(aProgress,
aRequest,
aURI)

This fires when the location bar changes; i.e load event is confirmed or when the user switches tabs.  If you use myListener for more than one tab/window, use aProgress.DOMWindow to obtain the tab/window which triggered the change.

Parameters

aProgressObject (unused but required)
aRequestObject (unused but required)
aFlagObject (unused but required)
aStatusObject (unused but required)

getLocation

PageObserver.prototype.getLocation = function()

Process the location properties that refer to the current location of the document.  These properties will correspond to the URI shown in the location bar, which can be different from the documentURI of the document.

Location contains these attributes

  • String host
  • String hostname
  • String href
  • String pathname
  • String port
  • String protocol
  • String search

Return

Location Object;

getDocument

PageObserver.prototype.getDocument = function()

Return

Document instance.

getBody

PageObserver.prototype.getBody = function()

Return just the body DOM element of the document.
